ravynn_visit: ^"Let’s meet Ravynn. She got the most potential out of all the recruits. I bet my tail feathers she’ll be the real deal."
^I step onto the stern deck. The air feels rigid — maybe it’s the salt or maybe it’s the sheer pressure from someone who looks like they coordinate stress.
^Every rope is perfectly coiled and every crate sealed and stacked like a warehouse.
^And yeah, there she is — sitting cross-legged, sharpening the harpoon like it personally insulted her.
^"I was wondering when you’d get up. You’re late — I already inspected the mast, adjusted the sails, and fixed three structural flaws in the hull."
ravynn_intro_intense: ^"Intensity keeps people alive. Comfort and sleeping in don’t."
ravynn_intro_approve: ^"Already fixing the ship? I like the initiative."
^"Initiative isn’t optional when lives are on the line."
ravynn_intro_direct: ^"The sea doesn’t wait and neither do I."
ravynn_continues: ^"I’m Ravynn — strategist, realist, and problem solver. I don’t believe in chance or luck. I believe in plans, strategies, contingencies."
^(Ravynn gestures toward a perfectly arranged supply storage. They're labelled, stacked, and possibly blessed. Or cursed. Hard to tell.)
^"And you? What kind of Captain are you?"
ravynn_style_lead: ^"I lead by example. I get my hands dirty."
ravynn_style_delegate: ^"I delegate. That’s what having a crew is for."
^(Ravynn glances — disappointed — at a rope coil.)
^"Delegation only works if the crew isn’t made of idiots."
ravynn_style_gut: ^(She exhales, looking as if I offended logic itself.)
ravynn_philosophy: ^"I understand your mindset, but part of the sea’s beauty is its unpredictability. The unknown and wild raw emotion of it — sometimes riding along with the waves is all you can do."
^"Not for me. Structure is everything. The moment you surrender control is when chaos takes everything."
^"I’ll keep things running. But if anyone steps out of line? I’ll know — and deal with it my own way."
^"Enjoy the calm while it lasts, Captain. Life and the seas are never always serene."
ravynn_flirt: ^"You're intense. Really intense. There’s something about it... it's solid. Reliable."
^"Reliability is the foundation of survival. If that’s what impresses you — good."
^(She returns to sharpening her harpoon, but I catch the faintest smile.)
^"Squaaak — was that flirting or an interrogation?"
^"A little bit of both. Not sure who won."
^"Definitely her. You like the scary ones, don’t you?"
^(I glance back. She’s already reorganizing the ropes. I walk away. Respectfully.)
ravynn_dismiss: ^"Right, right — we get it. You’ve got the ship handled. Just make sure your grip doesn’t end up breaking the crew."
^"If they can’t handle it, they shouldn’t be out here."
^"Not everyone is built like steel, Ravynn."
^(I turn and walk back. She doesn’t look back — and neither do I.)
^"Squaaak — she’s not just intense. She’s ferocious."
^"Yeah. And if she ever snaps, we’ll all be going overboard... in alphabetical order probably."
^(I look back one more time — she’s still sharpening that harpoon.
^I realize my hand is gripping the hem of my sleeve without even noticing.)
